thread.title: Hundreds of passengers stranded in Cyprus after Thomas Cook plane bound for Gatwick returned an hour into the flight because the air conditioning wasn't working

author: John Hutchinson for MailOnline
title: Hundreds of passengers stranded in Cyprus after Thomas Cook plane bound for Gatwick returned an hour into the flight because the air conditioning wasn't working
text:
View
comments
British holidaymakers have been left stranded in Cyprus after their plane bound for Gatwick was forced to return to the island as the air conditioning wasn't working.
Thomas Cook flight TCX1017 set out from Larnaca Airport at 11.30pm local time, already an hour behind schedule, but landed back in Cyprus at 2am local time.
One passenger, currently in Larnaca, told MailOnline Travel that they have been told they will be given an update at 3pm local time, more than 12 hours after they returned.
The Thomas Cook plane had to return to Larnaca Airport after a problem was discovered with the air con
He also said that the plane 'got spun around because there was no aircon.'
Meanwhile others took to Twitter to vent their frustration.
 Welcome to the 'Condom-inium': Stay in this Ibiza apartment... He ran out of countries! Meet the youngest person to visit... 'Highway to the Danger Zone!' Moment Southwest Airlines crew... The seals outnumber the guests! Scottish holiday island with... User Mitch wrote on the micro blogging platform that the plane had only been in the air for 'an hour' before it 'turned round'. And he spoke of being angry at still being in Cyprus.
Chris Lord wrote that there were '300 passengers stranded at Larnaca,' and that there was 'no rep in sight and they'd hadn't even been given any water to drink.'
Worryingly, Peter Briant added that he feared he might not even be able to fly out today, and hash-tagged that passengers were given 'one beverage only' for the long delay.
Mitch took to Twitter to express his frustration at still been in Cyprus while Chris Lord was less than impressed with how the situation was been handled
There were around 300 passengers on the plane, many of whom are Britons returning from their summer holidays.
A spokesperson for Thomas Cook Airlines told MailOnline Travel: 'We’d like to sincerely apologise for the delay to this flight. The captain made the decision to return to Larnaca at around 11pm yesterday UK time due to a fault with the air conditioning system.
'Customers would have felt the cabin become much warmer as a result – this is due to the body heat of that many people in an enclosed space.
'Subsequently, we’ve pulled out all the stops to ensure the customers were taken care of really well. All customers were put up in hotels overnight – mostly in the Hilton – and provided with all meals and drinks.
Passengers returned to Larnaca Airport less than three hours after setting off
Peter Briant was not even confident the passengers would return to the UK today
'They have remained in the hotels all day today and are about to be picked up to return to the airport to check-in again while the air conditioning fault is repaired.
'They will receive vouchers for food and drink at the airport when they arrive and they will be provided with complementary food and refreshments during the flight. Any additional charges, such as parking, that have been incurred at Gatwick as a result of the delay, will be refunded.
'The departure time from Larnaca will be mid-afternoon UK time.'
